Package rubank

Class DateTest

java.lang.Object
pizzapizza.DateTest
public class DateTest extends Object
The DateTest class is a JUnit test class for testing the functionality of the Date class. It contains various test cases to ensure that the Date class correctly handles date validation, including valid and invalid dates, leap years, and out-of-range values for months and days.
Author:
Sibi suriyanarayan Tiruchirapalli venketaramani and Rahulraj Rajesh

  • Method Details

    • testDaysInFebNonLeap

      public void testDaysInFebNonLeap()
      This method is a JUnit test case for testing the validation of a date in February of a non-leap year. It tests whether the `isValid` method of the Date class correctly handles an invalid date in February of a non-leap year. The test performs the following steps: 1. Creates a Date object representing February 29, 2011, which is an invalid date in a non-leap year. 2. Calls the `isValid` method on the created Date object. 3. Asserts that the `isValid` method returns false, indicating that the date is not valid in this context.

    • testDaysInFebLeap

      public void testDaysInFebLeap()
      This method is a JUnit test case for testing the validation of a date in February of a leap year. It tests whether the `isValid` method of the Date class correctly handles a valid date in February of a leap year. The test performs the following steps: 1. Creates a Date object representing February 29, 2024, which is a valid date in a leap year. 2. Calls the `isValid` method on the created Date object. 3. Asserts that the `isValid` method returns true, indicating that the date is valid in this context.

    • monthOutOfRange

      public void monthOutOfRange()
      This method is a JUnit test case for testing the validation of a date with a month value that is out of the valid range. It tests whether the `isValid` method of the Date class correctly handles an invalid date where the month is out of the valid range (1 to 12). The test performs the following steps: 1. Creates a Date object representing a date with a month value of 0 (out of range), a valid day (1), and a valid year (2023). 2. Calls the `isValid` method on the created Date object. 3. Asserts that the `isValid` method returns false, indicating that the date is not valid due to the out-of-range month value.

    • dayOutOfRange

      public void dayOutOfRange()
      This method is a JUnit test case for testing the validation of a date with a day value that is out of the valid range for the given month. It tests whether the `isValid` method of the Date class correctly handles an invalid date where the day is out of the valid range for the given month. The test performs the following steps: 1. Creates a Date object representing a date with a month (April) and a day value (31) that is out of the valid range for April. 2. The year (2023) is set to a valid value. 3. Calls the `isValid` method on the created Date object. 4. Asserts that the `isValid` method returns false, indicating that the date is not valid due to the out-of-range day value for the specified month.

    • dayIsToday

      public void dayIsToday()
      This method is a JUnit test case for testing the validation of a date equaling today's date. It tests whether the `isValid` method of the Date class correctly handles a day today. The test performs the following steps: 1. Creates a Date object representing a date with a valid month (April), a valid day (1), and a valid year (2024). 2. Calls the `isValid` method on the created Date object. 3. Asserts that the `isValid` method returns false, indicating today is not valid.

    • dayIsFutureDay

      public void dayIsFutureDay()
      This method is a JUnit test case for testing the validation of a future date. It tests whether the `isValid` method of the Date class correctly handles an invalid date which is in the future. The test performs the following steps: 1. Creates a Date object representing a date with an invalid month value (July), a valid day (1), and a valid year (2023). 2. Calls the `isValid` method on the created Date object. 3. Asserts that the `isValid` method returns false, indicating that the date is not valid for a future date

    • pastDate

      public void pastDate()
      This method is a JUnit test case for testing the validation of a date that represents a date in the past. It tests whether the `isValid` method of the Date class correctly handles a date that is in the past, relative to the current date. The test performs the following steps: 1. Creates a Date object representing a date in the past (January 20, 2023). 2. Calls the `isValid` method on the created Date object. 3. Asserts that the `isValid` method returns True, indicating that the date is a valid past date.
